name: prominent
content:
prominent adjective
(FAMOUS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 very well known and important: a prominent Democrat a prominent member of the Saudi royal family The government should be playing a more prominent role in promoting human rights.

prominent adjective
(NOTICEABLE)
sticking out from a surface: She has a prominent chin/nose.
C2 Something that is in a prominent position can easily be seen or noticed: New books are displayed in a prominent position on tables at the front of the store.
More examplesFewer examplesThe shop front occupies a very prominent position on the main street.His photo stood in a prominent place on her desk.
